intro: Razoumofskya divaricata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Tanzania. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers, which come in shades of purple, pink, and white, bloom throughout the year under proper care. Razoumofskya divaricata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
